page.title: 03CRANHAM FEAST
page.content: Cranham Feast started in the 1700s then it stopped in the 1880s restarted again in 1908 then because of the wars it stopped then in 1951 it started and has been going ever since. They have a deer roasting on a spit and you pay so much for a roll. There's a mime written by Ralph Reader in 1952 when the squire comes out to meet his villagers in old fashioned clothes. Then there's a parade of hounds and horses when they come into the ring and the children go and see them. There's a tug of war, after that there's a boundary race when the men and women run part of the way round Cranham. In the morning there's a flower display at the church.In the afternoon there's a parade across the common. At the feast there is a fun fair.This year it's held on the 12th of August. BY MATTHEW CHARMAN(age 7)
